meta.title: The New Yorker Literary
meta.description: Understated elegance meets stark editorial drama. Eustace Tilley sophistication - refined typography, intellectual restraint, subtle wit. High contrast black and white with surgical precision.

typography.principle: Typography IS the design. Every letterform matters. Favor classical proportions and generous whitespace.

font.name: Playfair Display
font.note: High contrast serif with sharp, refined hairlines

font.name: Libre Baskerville
font.note: Optimized for screen reading while retaining classical elegance

font.name: Cormorant Garamond
font.note: Lighter, more delicate for supporting text

font.name: Spectral
font.note: Readable at small sizes while maintaining serif character

avoid.reason: Sans-serif fonts destroy the literary atmosphere. This aesthetic is uncompromisingly serif.

color.principle: Stark, dramatic, uncompromising. Black ink on white paper. Color is earned - use sparingly for maximum impact.

color.name: ink
color.description: Rich black ink - not pure #000, but close. Authoritative.

color.name: paper
color.description: Bright white paper with the faintest warmth

color.name: silver
color.description: Light gray for disabled states, subtle dividers

color.name: vermillion
color.description: Classic editorial red. Use for: active states, critical moments, Cupid's arrow

motion.principle: Restrained and purposeful. Movement should feel like turning pages, not bouncing balls. Elegance over energy.

animation.name: page-enter
animation.description: Content fades up from below like a revealed page
animation.keyframes: from { opacity: 0; transform: translateY(12px); } to { opacity: 1; transform: translateY(0); }

animation.name: rule-draw
animation.description: Horizontal rules draw themselves from left to right
animation.keyframes: from { transform: scaleX(0); transform-origin: left; } to { transform: scaleX(1); }

animation.name: fade-subtle
animation.description: Subtle opacity transitions for hover states

pattern.name: editorial-reveal
pattern.description: Content blocks reveal in sequence like a magazine spread unfolding

avoid.reason: This is a literary magazine, not a children's app

backgrounds.principle: White space is sacred. Backgrounds should recede, never compete. Texture is optional and subtle.

treatment.name: editorial-surface
treatment.description: Slightly recessed surface for cards and panels

treatment.name: crosshatch-subtle
ruled-paper
treatment.description: Faint horizontal rules like a composition notebook

components.principle: Every element should look like it belongs in a beautifully typeset magazine. Borders are hairlines. Corners are sharp or gently rounded - never pill-shaped.

style.name: editorial-card
primary
ghost
editorial-rule
style.description: Short, bold rule used as a section marker

style.name: double-rule
style.description: Classic double rule for major section breaks

style.name: astrological
style.description: Stark, outlined badges for astrological placements

layout.principle: Magazine-inspired grids. Generous margins. Let content breathe. Asymmetry can be powerful when intentional.

spacing.note: Prefer larger spacing. Cramped layouts betray the aesthetic.

pattern.name: magazine-spread
pattern.description: Two-column layout with generous gutter, asymmetric content weighting

pattern.name: editorial-stack
pattern.description: Single column with large margins, content centered or left-aligned

iconography.principle: Line illustrations over solid icons. Think New Yorker spot illustrations - refined, witty, hand-drawn quality.
